job.title: je
job.description:
{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-08-25T17:24:36.000Z", "description": "

Our client has an outstanding opportunity for an Executive Assistant to C-level executives. The office is located in Dallas, Texas. - Near the Trinity River Bridge.

For those wondering, this is a C-level executive assistant so it's NOT REMOTE - that wouldn't make sense, but solid work/life balance w/w40 hr work week.


MUST have experience working as an Executive assistant of at least 5 years. No short work tenures. Must be a hard worker, self-starter without the need for close management or monitoring.

The base range starts from $67K-$72K, plus bonus, PTO, and full benefits package, etc.


Construction, Architecture, Real Estate, or Oil & Gas is a big plus.


Fast hiring process.


Executive Support

\u2022 Completes a broad variety of administrative tasks for the executive team including: managing an extremely active calendar of appointments; composing and preparing correspondence that is sometimes confidential; arranging detailed travel plans, itineraries, and agendas; scheduling interviews, and compiling documents for travel-related meetings.

\u2022 Plans, coordinates and ensures the CEO's schedule is followed and respected. Provides \"gatekeeper\" and \"gateway\" role, creating win-win situations for direct access to the CEO's time and office.

\u2022 Researches, prioritizes, and follows up on incoming issues and concerns addressed to the President, including those of a sensitive or confidential nature. Determines appropriate course of action, referral, or response.

\u2022 Provides a bridge for smooth communication between the President's office and internal departments; demonstrating leadership to maintain credibility, trust and support with senior management staff.

\u2022 Works closely and effectively with the C-level to keep him/her informed of upcoming commitments and responsibilities, following up appropriately. Acts as a \"barometer,\" having a sense for the issues taking place in the environment.

\u2022 Provides leadership to build relationships crucial to the success of the organization, and manages a variety of special projects, some of which may have organizational impact.

\u2022 Successfully completes critical aspects of deliverables with a hands-on approach that facilitate the CEO's ability to effectively lead the company.

\u2022 Prioritizes conflicting needs; handles matters expeditiously, proactively, and follows-through on projects to successful completion, often with deadline pressures.

\u2022 Participates as an adjunct member of the Executive Team including assisting in scheduling meetings and attending all meetings

\u2022 Assists in coordinating the agenda of senior management team meetings and off-sites, and all staff meetings

  • Strong organizational skills

\u2022 Demonstrated proactive approaches to problem-solving with strong decision-making capability

\u2022 Emotional maturity

\u2022 Highly resourceful team-player, with the ability to also be extremely effective independently
